descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is an intermediate level course in Hebrew. The purpose of the course is to enlarge the student's vocabulary and to reinforce and expand his/her knowledge of Hebrew grammar in order to improve conversational and writing skills as well as the ability to handle literary texts (from Biblical to modern).

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Northwestern students should have completed and received credit for 121-1. New students must have permission of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The lessons will center around the reading and discussion of literary texts (prose and poetry; occasionally-newspaper articles). Homework assignments will include written exercises, compositions and preparation for oral presentations in class.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on (1) daily homework assignments, (2) quizzes, (3) oral presentations, (4) a midterm exam or paper and (5) a final exam.
